discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
correct

questions.question_text:
A company is expanding its existing log storage and alerting solutions. All company Palo Alto Networks firewalls currently forward logs to Panorama.

Which two additional log forwarding methods will PAN-OS support? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Investigate decryption logs of the specific traffic to determine reasons for failure.
choices.A: Move the policy with action decrypt to the top of the decryption policy rulebase.
choices.E: Create a policy-based "No Decrypt" rule in the decryption policy to exclude specific traffic from decryption.
choices.C: Temporarily disable SSL decryption for all websites to troubleshoot the issue.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
A-> the policy with action "decrypt"

We need to look at the answers separately, so we can check the logs for errors & we can disable ssl decryption completely & we can create a specific no decrypt rule for this site .... in order to find out the root cause.

Selected Answer: BCE
Why would you need to move the decryption policy above?
BCE

comments.content: why would you open a huge security hole in your network to troubleshoot a problem with a few websites

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
Read these two articles, I think it is B, C, E.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-2/pan-os-admin/decryption/temporarily-disable-ssl-decryption

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/11-1/pan-os-admin/decryption/troubleshoot-and-monitor-decryption

Selected Answer: BE
Only B and E makes sence to me. Why should I disable SSL decryption for ALL?

comments.content: Answer A says action decrypt, not no-decrypt. And you think of all the answers together, you have to think of each answer as a specific action, so to speak.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
A B and E i think, choice E is not compatible with C, if you are disabling all SSL decryption you dont need a no decrypt rule, plus you also wouldnt need to move the policy to the top.

Selected Answer: BCE
I think B, C and E.

questions.question_text:
A firewall administrator has confirmed reports of a website is not displaying as expected, and wants to ensure that decryption is not causing the issue.

Which three methods can the administrator use to determine if decryption is causing the website to fail? (Choose three.)

choices.C: scp export mgmt-pcap from mgmt.pcap to < username@host:path>
choices.B: scp extract mgmt-pcap from mgmt.pcap to < username@host:path>
choices.A: scp export tcpdump from mgmt.pcap to < username@host:path>

discussion.content: u supposed to know this stuff of the top of your head, seriously

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct one

comments.content: tcpdump is a command, mgmt-pcap is the type of dump captured and mgmt.pcap is the file outputted by tcpdump

discussion.content: it is very confused . because export tcpdump in question, but mgmt-cap in answer.

questions.question_text: Which CLI command can be used to export the tcpdump capture?

After implementing a new NGFW, a firewall engineer is alerted to a VoIP traffic issue. After troubleshooting, the engineer confirms that the firewall is alerting the voice packets payload.

What can the engineer do to solve the VoIP traffic issue?

choices.D: Increase the TCP timeout under H.323 application
choices.A: Increase the TCP timeout under SIP application

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
ALG (Application Layer Gateway) can sometimes interfere with VoIP traffic by modifying or inspecting SIP packets in a way that disrupts proper communication. Disabling ALG for SIP can resolve issues related to SIP traffic being improperly handled by the firewall, ensuring that the VoIP traffic flows correctly.

Selected Answer: A
Analysis are done independently and are shared globally

choices.C: Palo Alto Networks owns and maintains one global cloud and four WildFire regional clouds.
choices.D: The WildFire Global Cloud only provides bare metal analysis.
choices.A: Each WildFire cloud analyzes samples independently of the other WildFire clouds.
choices.B: To comply with data privacy regulations, WildFire signatures and verdicts are not shared globally.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is considering deploying WildFire globally.

What should the administrator consider with regards to the WildFire analysis process?
